page.title: 06Shepley Bed Push.
page.content: The Shepley Bed Push is an annual event in the village. It was started in 1983 by Dr.L.Orme in order to raise funds for the local Hospice charity. It involves teams of ten people, and each team pushing a decorated bed around a course covering twelve miles through the villages of Shepley,Denby Dale, Skelmanthorpe,Shelley and Kirk- burton. While the 'pushing' is going on, a carnival and pig roast is held in a field until the beds return, which can take between 3 and 8 hours. Prizes are given for the best decorated bed (and team) and for collecting the most sponsor money. In it's first year, thirteen beds entered and Â£4,000 was raised. This year thirty seven beds entered and Â£10,000 was raised. The event has now become one of the local customs.
